answers.answer: Have you had your gestational diabetes test done yet? Might be worth mentioning it to your doc. Otherwise at least you know you're not at risk of dehydration!

Yeah.. i had it at like 28 weeks I think. somewhere around there.. im 38 weeks today. i had blood work done and 5 hrs of monitoring for pre-eclampsia yesterday. im not sure they would check blood sugar with that set of testing though.. i didnt even think to ask. i have my follow up appt on Tues so I will definitely bring it up when I go in! It never occurred to me that it could be something like that..
I have the same problem. If water isn't doing it for me I sip gatorade, so I don't risk not sleeping cus of constant peeing... I had my test done as well and passed it. I'm 32 weeks.
Me too! Healthy here! Just so thirsty

question: I drink a ridiculous amount of water all day everyday. Outside of 2-3 glasses of milk and a glass of orange juice with my breakfast, it is all I drink all day long.. but it seems that at night, my thirst becomes unquenchable!  Which ***** for the whole getting up to pee a million times a night thing.. i understand that we tend to fall back on our hydration during hours that we are asleep.. for obvious reasons.. so i take a few sips whenever I get up to pee just to wet my whistle.. but seriously, I have to show some major restraint or I would never sleep! Every time I feel like I could chug a gallon of ice water.. does this happen to anyone else at night?
title: Soooo thirsty!!!
